node.title: Dozens of Dogs Kept in 'Inhumane Conditions' Seized From Illegal Puppy Farm
node.alt: A police photo showing some of the dogs that were seized from the apartment in Dublin, Ireland.
node.description: "Most of the adult dogs were completely covered from head to toe in excrement," an animal welfare charity involved with the operation said.
node.content:
["Dozens of dogs, as well as several other other animals, have been seized from two adjoining apartments in Dublin, Ireland, where they were being kept in \"inhumane conditions.\"", "Officers with An Garda S\u00edoch\u00e1na\u2014Ireland's national police service\u2014searched the two apartments located in the Citywest area on Wednesday in an operation that also involved officials from the South Dublin County Council and the Dublin Society for the Prevention of Cruelty to Animals (DSPCA).", "In total, police removed 38 animals in total, most of which were dogs\u2014including several puppies\u2014a police spokesperson said. The animals were seized due to welfare concerns under the country's Animal Health and Welfare Act.", "After being removed from the apartment, officials took the animals to the DSPCA in order to receive veterinary medical treatment.", "Police have yet to make any arrests over the incident and the investigation is ongoing, the spokesperson said.", "The animals were being kept in small crates that were stacked on top of each other, with some of the dogs covered in excrement. They had no bedding and no space to walk around.", "\"Most of the adult dogs were completely covered from head to toe in excrement. Their little faces just says it all,\" the DSPCA said in a statement. \"Completely heartbreaking to see any animal being treated like this.\"", "According to the DSPCA, the animals seized included 33 dogs (one of which was deceased), one corn snake, two tarantulas (one deceased), two large parrots, two adult cats, a dead scorpion, and a dead centipede.", "The seizure of the animals was part of a larger police investigation, the DSPCA said.", "It is believed that the majority of the animals were being bred for sale, despite the fact that the apartments were not suitable or registered as a dog breeding establishment, making it an illegal puppy farm.", "All of the surviving animals are now being cared for at a DSPCA shelter and are receiving treatment from the charity's veterinarians and care staff.", "\"They are all part of an ongoing investigation and we are not seeking homes for any of these animals at present,\" the DSPCA said.", "This is not the only case of cruelty involving large numbers of animals that has emerged recently. In late October, dozens of \"extremely hungry\" cats, including one with a broken leg, were rescued from a hoarder in Weld County, Colorado.", "In September, 46 animals living in filthy conditions were also seized from a property in Flagler County, Florida, in September.", "And in August, animal shelter officials rescued 23 dogs from what they described as \"deplorable conditions\" at an address in Kentucky.", "", "
A police photo showing some of the dogs that were seized from the apartment in Dublin, Ireland.
"]
